definition: catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: They give short weight in that store.
sentences.chinese: 那家商店售货斤两不足。

sentences.english: They know what they are about and don' really care what others think.
sentences.chinese: 他们知道自己的斤两也不在乎别人说自己什么。

sentences.english: What the teacher said should not be taken lightly.
The first round of games will tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 第一轮小组赛过后就会知道彼此的斤两。

definition: to weigh in the hand/to consider/to ponder
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
a couple of times/to repeat the same/the same old trick/tricks of the trade
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
